title: Ten Hag cajoles Man Utd into two blockbuster signings with arrivals to come from spectacular six - man shortlist
body_text:
Manchester United
Premier League • England
Ten Hag cajoles Man Utd into two blockbuster signings with arrivals to come from spectacular six-man shortlist
Erik ten Hag has strong-armed Man Utd into making a second major transfer splash in the summer and the arrivals are likely to come from an all-star six-man list, while a third signing could occur if Harry Maguire is axed, per a report.
Despite Marcus Rashford’s sensational form as a centre-forward of late, the common consensus is Manchester United will sign a new high profile frontman at season’s end.
Whether the new face will push Rashford out wide or play alongside the Englishman in a two is a question for another day.
The Telegraph stressed the two primary strikers Ten Hag will choose between are Tottenham’s Harry Kane and Victor Osimhen of Napoli. Both deals will be difficult to make, not least because the respective players are valued over the £100m mark.
Now, a fresh report from the Manchester Evening News has doubled down on the striker signing claims. However, they also revealed Ten Hag wants a brand new central midfielder and given the impact he’s made, is likely to get his wish.
Firstly, Kane and Osimhen are both cited by the MEN, though there are two other No 9s on the club’s radar.
Benfica’s Goncalo Ramos, 21, and Ajax’s Mohammed Kudus, 22, are the players in question.
Ten Hag is reportedly ‘impressed’ by Ramos who’s returned 27 goal contributions in 32 matches for Benfica this season. He also scored a hattrick at the World Cup in Portugal’s 6-1 thumping of Switzerland.
Kudus, meanwhile, would arguably be the lowest profile addition of the quartet. However, he’s a known commodity to Ten Hag given their shared time at Ajax and Ten Hag reckons Kudus has the game to thrive in the Premier League.
The MEN state United’s decision-makers have ‘prioritised’ the striker signing, though Ten Hag is demanding a midfield addition too.
Superstar midfielder to be second Man Utd signing
On that front, two tantalising names are cited – Frenkie de Jong and Jude Bellingham.
United famously courted De Jong for month after month last summer. Barcelona were willing to sell and woulde be again 12 months on, though the Dutchman did not want to leave.
Ten Hag is deemed ‘open’ to a renewed De Jong push. Perhaps acting in United’s favour this time around is the club’s remarkable resurgence under Ten Hag as well as the ability to offer Champions League football (barring a late-season slip).
Bellingham, meanwhile, will be difficult to sign given the likes of Liverpool, Man City and Real Madrid are all way ahead in the transfer race.
To help fund the moves and to conform with Financial Fair Play, multiple exits could be sanctioned.
Among the highest profile are Harry Maguire and Anthony Martial who are both understood to be up for sale. The MEN add if club captain Maguire does leave, a new centre-back would bring United’s summer recruitment drive to three.
Maguire has fallen behind Raphael Varane and Lisandro Martinez in the pecking order this term. What’s more, left-back Luke Shaw has been deployed out of position at centre-half on multiple occasions.
The Daily Mail recently reported United are ‘resigned’ to generating no more than half the £80m they paid if Maguire does depart.
West Ham are an early contender for his signature, per ESPN.
